term.title: calendula
term.def: a plant cultivated for its yellow-orange flowers, often for medicinal purposes

term.title: ceramides
term.def: the most common class of intercellular lipids found in the stratum corneum; they help sustain skin hydration and skin barrier function

term.title: colorant
term.def: a substance used for coloring, such as a pigment or dye

term.title: cortisol
term.def: a hormone released by the adrenal gland when a person is under stress

term.title: dermis
term.def: the sensitive connective tissue layer of the skin located below the epidermis, containing nerve endings, sebaceous glands, and blood and lymph vessels

term.title: emollient
term.def: an agent that softens or soothes the skin

term.title: epidermis
term.def: the outer, protective, nonvascular layer of the skin; it covers the dermis

term.title: flavonoids
term.def: plant pigment compounds with antioxidant properties

term.title: glycerin
term.def: a sweet, colorless, oily fluid that is a pharmaceutical grade of the sugar alcohol glycerol

term.title: hypoallergenic
term.def: designed to reduce or minimize an allergic response

term.title: mineral oil
term.def: a hydrocarbon oil made by refining petroleum; it has been found to be harmful if ingested by children

term.title: neuromotor
term.def: pertaining to both nerves and muscles

term.title: norepinephrine
term.def: a hormone and neurotransmitter that causes blood vessel constriction and increases in heart rate and blood pressure

term.title: papillary dermis
term.def: uppermost layer of the dermis; it is composed of loosely arranged collagen fibers that are intertwined with the epidermis

term.title: paraben
term.def: widely used preservative in pharmaceutical, over-the-counter, cosmetic, personal care, and food products; the most common are methylparaben, propylparaben, and butylparaben

term.title: petrolatum
term.def: translucent, gelatinous substance obtained from petroleum; also called petroleum jelly

term.title: quercetin
term.def: a yellow plant pigment with anti-inflammatory properties

term.title: stratum corneum
term.def: the outermost layer of the epidermis consisting chiefly of dead layers of flattened, nonnucleated cells filled with a fibrous protein called keratin; it also contains an intercellular lipid membrane, which serves to sustain skinâ€™s water content

term.title: transepidermal water loss (TEWL):
term.def: the quantity of water that passes from inside the body through the epidermal layer

term.title: zinc oxide
term.def: an insoluble white solid used in pharmaceutical and cosmetic products
